content:
TITLE: Install Faraday using PyPi
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to install Faraday using pip3, initialize the database, and start the Faraday server. Requires Python 3 and pip.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ pip3 install faradaysec
$ faraday-manage initdb
$ faraday-server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Faraday using Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to install and run Faraday using Docker Compose. It fetches the docker-compose.yaml file and starts the containers defined within.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/infobyte/faraday/master/docker-compose.yaml
$ docker-compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Faraday from Source
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to install Faraday from source using virtualenv.  It clones the repository, creates a virtual environment, installs dependencies, initializes the database, and starts the server. Requires git, Python 3, and virtualenv.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ pip3 install virtualenv
$ virtualenv faraday_venv
$ source faraday_venv/bin/activate
$ git clone git@github.com:infobyte/faraday.git
$ pip3 install .
$ faraday-manage initdb
$ faraday-server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Faraday from Binary Packages (Debian/RPM)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install Faraday from a Debian package, initialize the database, and start the Faraday server using systemctl. Requires a Debian-based system with apt and systemctl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ sudo apt install faraday-server_amd64.deb
# Add your user to the faraday group
$ faraday-manage initdb
$ sudo systemctl start faraday-server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Faraday CLI
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install the Faraday command-line interface (CLI) using pip3. The CLI allows users to interact with Faraday from the terminal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ pip3 install faraday-cli
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Faraday CLI Tool Run Example
DESCRIPTION: Example of running a tool, in this case nmap, and processing the output through the faraday-cli tool.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ faraday-cli tool run \"nmap www.exampledomain.com\"
ðŸ’» Processing Nmap command
Starting Nmap 7.80 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2021-02-22 14:13 -03
Nmap scan report for www.exampledomain.com (10.196.205.130)
Host is up (0.17s latency).
rDNS record for 10.196.205.130: 10.196.205.130.bc.example.com
Not shown: 996 filtered ports
PORT     STATE  SERVICE
80/tcp   open   http
443/tcp  open   https
2222/tcp open   EtherNetIP-1
3306/tcp closed mysql
Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 11.12 seconds
â¬† Sending data to workspace: test
âœ” Done

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Faraday using Docker
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to run Faraday using Docker. It assumes a Postgres database is already running and configures the Faraday container to connect to it using environment variables.  Volumes are mapped for persistent data. The necessary Postgres details must be provided.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
 $ docker run \
     -v $HOME/.faraday:/home/faraday/.faraday \
     -p 5985:5985 \
     -e PGSQL_USER='postgres_user' \
     -e PGSQL_HOST='postgres_ip' \
     -e PGSQL_PASSWD='postgres_password' \
     -e PGSQL_DBNAME='postgres_db_name' \
     faradaysec/faraday:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add Continuous Scanning Tool to Faraday
DESCRIPTION: Adds a continuous scanning tool (cscan) to the Faraday project. This allows for automated and ongoing vulnerability assessments. The tool is located at ./scripts/cscan.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/RELEASE.md#_snippet_5



----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add script to get IPs without services in Faraday
DESCRIPTION: Adds a script to get all IP addresses from targets without services defined in Faraday. This helps in identifying hosts that may not have been fully scanned or configured. The script is located at /bin/getAllIpsNotServices.py.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/RELEASE.md#_snippet_4



----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add script to get IPs by open port in Faraday
DESCRIPTION: Adds a script to get all IP addresses that have a defined open port in Faraday. This script retrieves a list of IP addresses based on their exposed services. The script is located at /bin/getAllbySrv.py.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/RELEASE.md#_snippet_3



----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add script to delete vulnerabilities by regex in Faraday
DESCRIPTION: Adds a script to delete vulnerabilities in Faraday that match a given regular expression pattern. This can be helpful for removing false positives or managing large numbers of vulnerabilities. The script is located at /bin/delAllVulnsWith.py.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/RELEASE.md#_snippet_2



----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add WcScan script and plugin for Faraday
DESCRIPTION: Adds the WcScan script and plugin to the Faraday project. WcScan is a tool used for scanning WordPress websites for vulnerabilities. The location of the script is scripts/wcscan.py.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/RELEASE.md#_snippet_6



----------------------------------------

TITLE: Get IPs Without Services Script
DESCRIPTION: This changelog entry from December 18, 2015, mentions a script named `/bin/getAllIpsNotServices.py` designed to retrieve all IPs from targets without services. This script is part of the Faraday plugin set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/CHANGELOG/footer.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
/bin/getAllIpsNotServices.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Get IPs with Open Ports Script
DESCRIPTION: This changelog entry from December 18, 2015, mentions a script named `/bin/getAllbySrv.py` designed to retrieve all IP addresses that have defined open ports. This script is part of the Faraday plugin set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/CHANGELOG/footer.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
/bin/getAllbySrv.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Delete Vulns Script
DESCRIPTION: This changelog entry from December 18, 2015, mentions a script named `/bin/delAllVulnsWith.py` designed to remove vulnerabilities matching a regex. This script is part of the Faraday plugin set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/CHANGELOG/footer.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
/bin/delAllVulnsWith.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Continuous Scanning Tool
DESCRIPTION: This changelog entry from Oct 2, 2015, refers to a continuous scanning tool named `cscan` added to the `./scripts/cscan` directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/CHANGELOG/footer.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
./scripts/cscan
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: WCScan Script and Plugin
DESCRIPTION: This changelog entry from March 9, 2015, mentions the introduction of a WcScan script and plugin for the Faraday platform. The script's location is explicitly stated as `scripts/wcscan.py`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/CHANGELOG/footer.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
scripts/wcscan.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Faraday CLI Tool Report Example
DESCRIPTION: Imports a burp.xml report into Faraday using the faraday-cli tool.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
faraday-cli tool report burp.xml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fix loading in server.ini with extra configs
DESCRIPTION: Addresses an issue where the `server.ini` file encountered problems when loading due to unexpected or extra configuration entries. This fix ensures the server can handle or ignore extraneous configurations without failing to load the core settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/RELEASE.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
Fix bug when loading in server.ini with extra configs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fix Parsing Server Port Config in server.ini
DESCRIPTION: This entry indicates a bug fix related to parsing the server port configuration within the `server.ini` file. This likely involves correcting how the server reads and interprets the port number specified in the configuration file, ensuring the server starts on the correct port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/RELEASE.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
Fix parsing server port config in server.ini
```

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changelog JSON Format
DESCRIPTION: Defines the JSON structure for changelog entries in Faraday versions 3.15.0 and later. Each entry includes a 'level' field specifying the edition (community, prof, corp) and an 'md' field containing the changelog text in markdown format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/infobyte/faraday/blob/master/CHANGELOG/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "level": "community|prof|corp",
  "md": "<changelog text>"
}
```
